etymologies: mid 16th century. Apparently from Spanish †genjoli, apparently aphetic from †agenjoli, variant of ajonjolí from Spanish Arabic al-jonjolī from Arabic al the + Spanish Arabic jonjolī, jonjolīl, variant of Arabic (literary) juljulān, (chiefly colloquial) jiljilān, juljalān sesame

definitions: Sesame oil; (also) the sesame plant, Sesamum indicum. Frequently attributive, especially in "gingelly oil".
